article.headline: George Mason 85, William &amp, Mary 69
article.story: WILLIAMSBURG, Va. -- Cam Long scored 20 points and Luke Hancock added 17 to lead George Mason to an 85-69 win over William & Mary on Saturday. Ryan Pearson finished with 15 points and a team-high seven rebounds for the Patriots (17-5, 9-2 Colonial Athletic Association). Andre Cornelius had 13 points and Isaiah Tate added 10. The game was close through much of the first half. George Mason held a 54-48 lead with 13:25 left in the game before the Patriots went on a 9-1 run, led by Long's four points during the spurt. The Tribe (5-17, 2-9), who have lost four straight, never recovered after the run as George Mason pushed its advantage to 19 points -- its largest of the game -- on a slam dunk by Hancock with 7:21 left. Quinn McDowell led William & Mary with 16 points and eight rebounds. Marcus had 12 points and eight rebounds, Brandon Britt had 14 points and Matt Rum chipped in with 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
